Logg’s main and united idea is Remembering. But not like as notes applications, or social media apps,  remembering really and really everything, every moments from wake up to sleep. This could be possible if we work tight and hard. So, we worked hard and created Logg. Logg is now in its baby steps era but she is growing. Logg has a big opportunity with limitless minds. Nowadays, Logg in market for about one month and users are slowly adapting theirselves to track every moment and live as a organized person. New features are on the way and they will never stop.Please give your support, make complaints, say good wishes and let’s walk together.  What is LOGG?Logg has focused on two different key features: different categorization of the all activities, both private logging and socialization on demand. Logg is an all-in-one life logging app. A diary, travel companion, your training assistant, budged tracker, health companion, reminder, manager, scheduler and analyzer. Logs, Categories and Subcategories  After creating your profile, you are able to create your logs in various different ways but the key element is that the app allows you to create your logs within single or multiple subcategories and put those subcategories in main categories. As an example: If the user would like to create a log about his/her cycling experience. While creating the related log, as a first step he need to choose a subcategory, most of the sport / outdoor activities are already in subcategory database but user can also create a unique subcategory with custom title and icon and use it as well. Then users can add some text and image if they like and create the log with a couple of single steps. All the default logs are created private, users are able to tag them as public and let them visible for their followers and friends. There is also a favorites bar in the main screen which includes your custom most used categories and subcategories. Also, there are different types of ways to create logs: Quick, Custom, Timer, Countdown, Repeat. Users are free to discover these features and invent different combinations to track their unique activities.  Social Features Users are free to use their personal log as social as possible. We had already mentioned that public logs are visible to friends and followers. There are 3 different levels of social environment in Logg. The first one is your own log and feed called "My Life". The second one is the feed you are able to see all the logs of the users you are following called "Social". The last and the third one is "Discover" the feed includes public logs of the users with similar interests. You can like, comment, filter and share all the public logs within the related feeds.  Analyze Your Activities In the stats screen users are able to see the summary of their activities considering, activity counts, categories, date and frequency. Also, one of the best features includes in this screen. Users are able to compare their activity stats with their friend of friends.   Integration Logg is supporting more and more third-party apps day by day. Currently the supported integrations are: Spotify, Swarm, Google Fit, Strava and Goodreads.  

 
Limitless Possibilities Record how many glasses you drink water, tea and coffee a day. Record how many kilometers you walk. Record when you buying and when you start using sunscreen. Set Reminder; do not forget to drink your medicines and to water your flowers. Write down your thoughts about the music you listen to and remember it later. Record the sentences you underlined in the books you read. Save places you trip, take photos and add. See how much time you spend on a daily job. Logg will show you how you spent your life. It will offer the opportunity to review your life. When you look back, you will encounter many events that you will say wow. And if you like, you can share it with the whole world or you can make it special to you.   You can save data that only you don’t want to forget and the data you want to track like your health situation, sport activities, travel details, barber or coiffeur appointments etc. only create Loggs for them. When was the last time I ate fish?When was the last time I went to church?When was the last time I went to hospital?When was the last time I went to opera?When was the last time I made barbecue?How many kilometers I walked?How long have I been working?How much exercise did I do last weekend?Just save your key points of your life if you want to. But, from another point of view, is not every moment of our life a key point?

story: Thanks for your support
story_txt: Thanks for your support

story:
The ultimate goal of Whos Your Guest is to eliminate the need for Whos Your Guest.  Yes, you read that correctly, we want to run ourselves out of business....:-)) But, before you put your hand back into your pocket, wait a sec. It's not going to happen that quickly.

The Chinese philosopher Lao Tzu said: "A journey of a thousand miles begins with one step" and we humbly would like to add that it is probably the first step that is the hardest. We have already taken that first step and now we would like you to accompany us in taking the next few ones

THE GUEST SIDE

  1. You are treated according to previous experiences the accommodation provider had with your compatriots. 
    When we travel, we are not referred to by our first name but by our Nationality. The Britt, the American, the Aussie etc. When one Britt leaves a bad impression, the next Britt will be treated accordingly and although these problematic travelers/tourists are the minority, the impact they leave is much bigger than their proportional size. With their foul actions they stain us all.
  2. You pay more for others behavior.
    When the "nightmare" guest trashes a hotel room, steals bathrobes, leaves without payment etc they increase the hotels costs. (A recent survey estimated that German travelers alone stole goods worth of 37 million euros in 2013. Table below). These costs are passed on to you, the law abiding guest,  by increasing room rates and that's not fair
  3. Ruin your vacation
    Who among us hasn’t encountered the obnoxious guest in one of our vacations? Badly behaving guests can ruin your hard worked and long waited for vacation. Drunk people shouting in the corridor in the middle of the night, people playing loud music by the pool as if no one else is around, families treating public areas as if they were the neighborhood garbage dump....the list goes on and on

 

THE HOTEL/HOSTEL SIDE

  1. Third party review sites such as Tripadvisor, Expedia, Zomato, Hostelworld  and Yelp and many others, encourage potential guests to read about and rely on previous guests  experiences before making their decision.  What about the hotels? Why can they not rely on other hotels experience before making their decisions to accept guests or not and under which conditions? 
  2. Problematic guests face absolutely no consequences for their actions. They can vandalize, steal,  be disrespectful to either staff or other guests, check out without paying and then cross the street to another hotel.  No one will ever find out about their past "history." 
  3. Reviews and criticism are the best ways to let hotels know what things they are doing well and what things they need to improve. However, some guests misuse the power of a review as a way to “blackmail” a hotel, shamelessly asking for upgrades or discounts in exchange for not posting a negative review. 

With WhosYourGuest.com registered Hotels and other players in the Hospitality business have the ability to do the following:

  1.  Search 

    Search on a guests history before accepting their reservation

  2. Report problematic guests:

    After filling guests details, hotels and lodging facilities will be able to report the circumstances of a case. Each report is reviewed by  Whos Your Guest to make sure it complies with our reporting guidelines and receives a qualification score from 1, (minor things like “no shows”), to 5, (serious things like theft or leaving without paying).

 

Hotels who receive reservations from reported guests will have the option to accept the reservation, accept with security measures like advance payment, charge more for the room because of the risk factor or decline the reservation.

For severe cases in their area Hotels also receive an alert by Email.

Whos your guest is already changing the conversation, relations and the way accommodation providers are communicating  with their guests. 

 

                     

Imagine a world where people care for each other, respect local cultures and their people, and treat those around them with equality, consideration, and kindness.  .....wow, we want to live in such a world.

By helping us to ensure that the only people who pay the consequences for the actions of inconsideration are the problematic guests themselves, we will be "eliminating" or reducing the negative in the tourism industry and the rest of us will be able to enjoy more our travels. This will be our little step toward living in a better world. 

 

As a platform WYG has no legal liability for information published by its users.  

Hotels and Hostels are responsible in obtaining the information from the guest in a legal way. (signed authorization)

WYG is  responsible for the storing and the use of this information between its members.  

WYG provides members with complete information and legal support about the requirements of the law in order to report problematic guests

As much as possible....:-) This is how Whos Your Guest? will use the funds; according to priority:

  • A professional website that has the capability to allow members to search reported guests database and to send automatic alerts in case of new reports. The main emphasis will be on data protection technologies and a user-friendly interface - $20,000 
  • Legal assistance, verifying laws of different countries, writing user contracts etc. - $12,000
  • Orientation campaign for participating hotels and establishments regarding the legal obligations related to the collection and handling of personal information providing the required legal instruments needed to fulfill all obligations - $10,000
  • Expanding services to additional countries, searchers, data base builders, client service, graphic designers etc. -  from $15,000
  • Internet advertising (Facebook, Google etc.) - $15,000
  • Office space, salaries, overhead, etc. are all covered for the near future

All funds collected will be distributed according to the specifications illustrated above. The more funds we are able to procure, the more we can grow the business model, expand to other countries, and improve the level of services we offer. Any funds received above the above-stated amounts will be used toward the creation of a social network for hotels and hostels which is part of the bigger vision we have but it's still not the time to reveal it all...:-)

When donating, if possible, please use the credit card option instead of the paypal, as with paypal there is an extra charge for us to receive your donation

If you are a big time investor, or know one, and realize the potential of this project, please drop us a line so we can chat further

 

Since we are an internet platform we don't have any physical products to sell or give as perks at a discounted price. However, we know that bakers looove perks so we turned to the Hotels and hostels members of our network and they were more than happy to help. Most perks you will find following were donated by one of our members as a sign of their satisfaction and appreciation for the noble idea behind WYG. This also explains why most are available in Ecuador, Panama or Colombia......:-)

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The dream team

CEO and founder - Inbal Tubi:   

My name is Inbal, only 48 years, married + 2. Now I’m supposed to say my profession and nationality. I have a problem defining both.

Let’s start with the profession. If it is defined but what you studied than since I’m a graduate of Ben-Gurion University in Israel with a degree in Economics and Business Management I guess I’m an economist. If it is defined by what you make you’re living from than since I have been owning hostels for the last 15 years I guess this makes me and independent business men. If it is defined by what you did most of your life, what you love and passionate about than since I have been traveling for the past 20 years, been to 83 countries, 6 continents and speak 5 languages I guess this makes me a traveler and globetrotter. If I have to choose between the three, that last one wins by far.

Now for the Nationality. If it is defined by where you were born than, I’m Israeli. If it’s defined by your passports, than I’m also Brazilian. If it’s defined by where your heart belongs, than I’m African, if i t's defined by where you live now than I'm Colombian and if it’s defined by where you feel at home than I belong everywhere. Personally, I don’t like definitions because they are limiting, so I like to think of myself as from everywhere and nowhere.

I have worked in almost all possible jobs there are. From frying French fries in NY, a fabric warehoused and a human dishwasher in Australia, selling jewelry on the streets of Japan, marketing manager for the wealthiest company in Israel with frequent travels abroad to owning and running a hostel in Brazil and just sold another one I had in Bogota, Colombia where I live today, to finance Whos Your Guest.  Unfortunately my dad could not give me a "small loan" of one million dollars  like Trumps dad did and funds are running out so I am depending on your generosity to help me continue with this very important project. 

In my spare time, I dream and plan my next travel. Final goal in life if to color every country on the world map tattooed on my back

 

 

CMO - Yahav Cohen            

My name is Yahav, 33. playing on the internet and trading fields for over 10 years. but my big passion is to own and work on my own Permaculture farm.

Meanwhile, my wife and I raise two kids a Doberman 3 chickens and two ducks in our urban garden.

Build and launched an e-commerce art related website, taking part in a restaurant service startup.

love to travel, snowboarding, camping and relax in my hammock after a long week.

 

 

COO - Motti Mor    

My Name is Motti Mor. I am a 37 year old dreamer and website designer. I have been wondering in the internet realm since the beginning of the internet era and started designing websites some 15 years ago.

My dream was always to work while I travel and I've followed it for many years and visited many parts of our exciting and beautiful planet.

Nowadays, I've decided to stay in one place for a while. I am raising my two beautiful sons and hold an MBA degree focused on Web Marketing.

I have met Inbal in NY about 20 years ago and ever since we have been walking side by side. I've joined  the " Whos Your Guest" project to try and make this world a just and better place.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

and the list can go on and on and on..............

 

 

Interesting statistics and reads:

The most common offenses reported on our database:

Booking sites problematic guests use:

The top 10 Countries With Notoriously Bad Tourists

Theft of hotel items: 4.5 million Germans do it / 1.3 million stolen towels​

There are many ways you can help us to reach our goal and make your next vacation more pleasant (and hopefully cheaper too!)

Here are three of them:

  1. Contribute. Whether it is a $1 or a $1000 contribution, each one has an impact and gets us closer to our goal.
     
  2. Spread the word to everybody you know.  Ask your friends to share our campaign on their social media (e.g. Twitter, Facebook, Google+). Please use this direct link to our campaign
    https://igg.me/at/whosyourguest/13920702

          

  1. When you travel and see someone behaving badly dont just ignore it. Let the hotel managment know about Whos Your Guest and the actions they can take.

Thank you so much for your help and support!

 

 

   

 

 

El objetivo final de Whos Your Guest es eliminar la necesidad de Whos Your Guest. Sí, lo leíste correctamente, queremos sacarnos a nosotros mismos del negocio ….:-) Pero, antes de poner tu mano de vuelta en tu bolsillo, espera un segundo. No va a suceder tan rápido.

El filósofo chino Lao Tzu dijo: "Un viaje de mil millas comienza con un paso" y humildemente queremos añadir que es probablemente el primer paso el que es más difícil. Ya hemos dado ese primer paso y ahora queremos que nos acompañes en dar los próximos

EL LADO DEL HUÉSPED

  1. Usted es tratado de acuerdo a experiencias anteriores que el proveedor de alojamiento tenía con sus compatriotas. 

    Cuando viajamos, no se refieren a nosotros por nuestro nombre sino por nuestra nacionalidad. Cuando un Britt deja una mala impresión, el próximo Britt será tratado en consecuencia a ésta y aunque estos turistas/viajeros problemáticos son la minoría, el impacto que dejan es mucho más grande que la proporción de su tamaño. Con sus malas acciones nos manchan a todos.

  2. Pagas más por el comportamiento de otros.​
    Cuando el huésped de "pesadilla" destruye una habitación de hotel, roba batas de baño, se va sin pagar, etc. aumentan los costos de los hoteles. (Una encuesta reciente estimó que los viajeros alemanes por sí solos robaron mercancías por un valor de 37 millones de euros en el 2013. Tabla a continuación). Estos costos se pasan a usted, el huésped respetuoso de la ley, al aumentar las tarifas de habitación y eso no es justo

  3. Arruinar sus vacaciones

    ¿Quién entre nosotros no ha encontrado al huésped desagradable en una de nuestras vacaciones? Los huéspedes con malos comportamientos pueden arruinar nuestras tan duramente trabajadas y anheladas vacaciones. Personas ebrias gritando en el pasillo en medio de la noche, gente escuchando música a alto volumen en la piscina como si no hubiera nadie más, familias tratando las zonas públicas como si fueran el basurero del barrio ... la lista sigue y sigue

 

EL LADO DEL HOTEL/HOSTEL

  1. Terceros sitios de crítica/revisión como TripAdvisor, Expedia, Zomato, Hostelworld, Yelp y muchos otros, alientan a posibles clientes a leer y confiar en las experiencias de huéspedes anteriores antes de tomar su decisión. ¿Qué pasa con los hoteles? ¿Por qué ellos no pueden confiar en las experiencias previas de otros hoteles antes de tomar sus decisiones para aceptar huéspedes o no y bajo qué condiciones?

  2. Huéspedes problemáticos no enfrentan absolutamente ninguna consecuencia por sus acciones. Pueden hacer actos de vandalismo, robar, ser irrespetuoso con el personal u otros huéspedes, salir sin pagar y luego cruzar la calle a otro hotel. Nadie sabrá jamás sobre su "historia" pasada.
     
  3. Comentarios y críticas son las mejores maneras de hacer saber a los hoteles qué cosas están haciendo bien y qué cosas necesitan mejorar. Sin embargo, algunos huéspedes usan mal el poder de una crítica como una forma de "chantaje" un hotel, descaradamente pidiendo mejoras o descuentos a cambio de no publicar una crítica negativa.

Con WhosYourGuest.com  los hoteles registrados y otros jugadores en el negocio de la hospitalidad tienen la capacidad de hacer lo siguiente:

  1.  Buscar 

    Buscar en la historia de huéspedes antes de aceptar su reserva

  2. Reportar huéspedes problemáticos:

    Después de diligenciar los detalles de los huéspedes, los hoteles y establecimientos de alojamiento serán capaces de reportar las circunstancias de un caso. Cada reporte es revisado por Whos Your Guest para asegurarse de que cumple con nuestras directrices de reporte y recibe una calificación de 1, (cosas menores como "no shows"), a 5 (cosas serias como robo o salir sin pagar).

 

Los hoteles que reciben reservas de los huéspedes reportados tendrán la opción de aceptar la reserva, aceptar con medidas de seguridad como pago por adelantado, cobrar más por la habitación debido al riesgo o rechazar la reserva.

Para casos severos en su área, los  hoteles también reciben una alerta por correo electrónico.

Whos Your Guest ya está cambiando las conversaciones, las relaciones y la forma en que los proveedores de alojamiento están comunicándose con sus huéspedes.

 

                     

Imagine un mundo donde la gente se cuide el uno al otro, respete las culturas locales y su gente, y trate a los que les rodean con igualdad, consideración y bondad…. wow, queremos vivir en un mundo así.

Al ayudarnos a asegurar que las únicas personas que paguen las consecuencias por los actos de desconsideración sean los huéspedes problemáticos por sí mismos, estaremos "eliminando" o reduciendo lo negativo en la industria del turismo y el resto de nosotros podremos disfrutar más nuestros viajes. Este será nuestro pequeño paso hacia la vida en un mundo mejor. 

 

Como plataforma WYG no tiene ninguna responsabilidad legal por la información publicada por sus usuarios.
Los hoteles y hostales son responsables de obtener la información del huésped de manera legal. (Autorización firmada)
WYG es responsable del almacenamiento y el uso de esta información entre sus miembros.
WYG proporciona a los miembros información completa y apoyo legal sobre los requisitos de la ley para informar a los huéspedes problemáticos

Tanto como sea posible .... :-) Así es como Whos Your Guest? Utilizará los fondos; por orden de prioridad:

  • Un sitio web profesional que tiene la capacidad de permitir a los miembros buscar huéspedes reportados en la base de datos y enviar alertas automáticas cuando hay nuevos reportes. El énfasis principal estará en las tecnologías de protección de datos y una interfaz fácil de usar - $ 20,000 
  • Asistencia legal, verificación de leyes de los diferentes países, redacción de contratos de usuarios, etc. - $ 12,000
  • Campaña de orientación para los hoteles y establecimientos participantes con respecto a las obligaciones legales relacionadas con la recolección y manejo de información personal proporcionando los instrumentos legales necesarios para cumplir con todas las obligaciones - $ 10,000
  • Ampliación de servicios a otros países, buscadores, constructores de bases de datos, servicio al cliente, diseñadores gráficos, etc. - desde $ 15,000
  • Publicidad en Internet (Facebook, Google, etc.) - $ 15.000
  • Espacio de oficina, sueldos, gastos generales, etc están cubiertos para el futuro cercano

Todos los fondos recaudados serán distribuidos de acuerdo con las especificaciones mencionadas anteriormente. Cuantos más fondos obtengamos, más podemos hacer crecer el modelo de negocio, expandirnos a otros países y mejorar el nivel de servicios que ofrecemos. Cualquier financiamiento recibido por encima de los montos arriba indicados se utilizará para la creación de una red social para hoteles y hostales que es parte de la visión más grande que tenemos, pero todavía no es el momento de revelar todo ... :-)

Al donar, si es posible, utilice la opción de tarjeta de crédito en lugar del paypal, ya que con paypal hay un cargo adicional por recibir su donación

Si usted es un gran inversor, o conoce uno, y se da cuenta del potencial de este proyecto, por favor, escríbanos para que podamos hablar más​

 

Puesto que somos una plataforma de Internet, no tenemos productos físicos que vender o dar como beneficios con un precio de descuento. Sin embargo, sabemos que los contribuyentes aaaaaman los beneficios, así que nos dirigimos a los hoteles y hostales miembros de nuestra red y estuvieron más que dispuestos a ayudar. La mayoría de los beneficios que encontrará a continuación fueron donados por uno de nuestros miembros como un muestra de su satisfacción y aprecio por la noble idea detrás de WYG. Esto también explica por qué la mayoría están disponibles en Ecuador, Panamá o Colombia ...... :-)

The dream team

CEO y Fundador  - Inbal Tubi:​   

Mi nombre es Inbal, sólo 48 años, casado + 2. Ahora se supone que tengo que decir mi profesión y nacionalidad. Tengo problemas para definir ambos.

Empecemos con la profesión. Si es definido por lo que estudié, entonces desde que soy graduado de la Universidad de Ben-Gurion en Israel con un título en Economía y Administración de Empresas supongo que soy un economista. Si se define por lo que hago para vivir, desde que he sido dueño de hostales durante los últimos 15 años, supongo que esto me hace un hombre de negocios independiente. Si se define por lo que hice la mayor parte de mi vida, por lo que amo  y me apasiona, desde que he viajado por los últimos 20 años, he estado en 83 países, 6 continentes y hablo 5 idiomas, supongo que esto me hace un viajero y trotamundos. Si tengo que elegir entre los tres, éste último gana por mucho.

Ahora por la nacionalidad. Si se define por donde nací, entonces soy Israelí. Si está definido por sus pasaportes, entonces también soy Brasileño. Si se define por dónde pertenece tu corazón, entonces soy Africano, si es definido por donde vives ahora  entonces soy Colombiano y si se define por donde te sientes como en casa entonces yo pertenezco a todas partes. Personalmente, no me gustan las definiciones porque son limitantes, así que me gusta pensar en mí como de todas partes y de ninguna parte.

He trabajado en casi todos los trabajos posibles que hay. Desde la fritura de papas fritas en Nueva York, un almacén de telas y un lavavajillas humano en Australia, la venta de joyas en las calles de Japón, gerente de marketing para la empresa más rica en Israel con viajes frecuentes al extranjero, a ser propietario y dirigir un hostal Brasil y acabo de vender otro que tuve en Bogotá, Colombia donde vivo hoy, para financiar a Whos Your Guest. Desafortunadamente mi papá no podía darme un "pequeño préstamo" de un millón de dólares como el de papá de Trump hizo y los fondos se están acabando así que estoy dependiendo de su generosidad para ayudarme a continuar con este proyecto tan importante.

En mi tiempo libre, sueño y planeo mi próximo viaje. Mi objetivo final en la vida es colorear cada país en el mapa del mundo tatuado en mi espalda

 

CMO - Yahav Cohen            

Mi nombre es Yahav, 33. Me he desempeñado en el Internet y los campos comerciales por más de 10 años. Pero mi gran pasión es poseer y trabajar en mi propia granja de Permacultura.

Mientras tanto, mi esposa y yo criamos a dos niños, un Doberman, 3 pollos y dos patos en nuestro jardín urbano.

Construí y lancé un sitio web de comercio electrónico relacionado con arte, y participando en un startup  de servicio de restaurante.

Me encanta viajar, hacer snowboard, acampar y relajarme en mi hamaca después de una larga semana.

 

 

COO - Motti Mor    

Mi nombre es Motti Mor. Soy un soñador de 37 años y diseñador de sitios web. He estado paseándome en el reino de Internet desde el principio de la era de Internet y comencé a diseñar sitios web hace unos 15 años.

Mi sueño siempre fue trabajar mientras viajo y lo he seguido durante muchos años. He visitado muchas partes de nuestro emocionante y hermoso planeta.

Hoy en día, he decidido quedarme en un lugar por un tiempo. Estoy criando a mis dos hermosos hijos y mantengo un MBA enfocado a  Web Marketing.

Conocí a Inbal en Nueva York hace unos 20 años y desde entonces hemos estado caminando lado a lado. Me he unido al proyecto "Whos Your Guest" para tratar de hacer de este mundo un lugar mejor y más justo.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

and the list can go on and on and on..............

 

 

Interesting statistics and reads:

The most common offenses reported on our database:

Booking sites problematic guests use:

The top 10 Countries With Notoriously Bad Tourists

Theft of hotel items: 4.5 million Germans do it / 1.3 million stolen towels​

Hay muchas maneras en las que puede ayudarnos a alcanzar nuestro objetivo y hacer que sus próximas vacaciones sean más agradables (y esperemos que sean más baratas!).

Aquí están tres de ellos:

  1. Contribuir. Ya se trate de una contribución de $1 o $1000, cada una tiene un impacto y nos acerca a nuestra meta.
     
  2. Corre la voz a todo el mundo que conoces. Pide a tus amigos que compartan nuestra campaña en sus redes sociales (por ejemplo, Twitter, Facebook, Google+). Por favor utilice este enlace directo a nuestra campaña https://igg.me/at/whosyourguest/13920702​ 

          

    1. Cuando viaje y vea a alguien comportándose mal, no lo ignore. Haga saber a la gerencia del hotel acerca de  Whos Your Guest y las acciones que pueden tomar.

    ¡Muchas gracias por su ayuda y apoyo!
story_txt:
The ultimate goal of Whos Your Guest is to eliminate the need for Whos Your Guest.  Yes, you read that correctly, we want to run ourselves out of business....:-)) But, before you put your hand back into your pocket, wait a sec. It's not going to happen that quickly.The Chinese philosopher Lao Tzu said: "A journey of a thousand miles begins with one step" and we humbly would like to add that it is probably the first step that is the hardest. We have already taken that first step and now we would like you to accompany us in taking the next few onesTHE GUEST SIDE

You are treated according to previous experiences the accommodation provider had with your compatriots. When we travel, we are not referred to by our first name but by our Nationality. The Britt, the American, the Aussie etc. When one Britt leaves a bad impression, the next Britt will be treated accordingly and although these problematic travelers/tourists are the minority, the impact they leave is much bigger than their proportional size. With their foul actions they stain us all.

You pay more for others behavior.When the "nightmare" guest trashes a hotel room, steals bathrobes, leaves without payment etc they increase the hotels costs. (A recent survey estimated that German travelers alone stole goods worth of 37 million euros in 2013. Table below). These costs are passed on to you, the law abiding guest,  by increasing room rates and that's not fair

Ruin your vacationWho among us hasn’t encountered the obnoxious guest in one of our vacations? Badly behaving guests can ruin your hard worked and long waited for vacation. Drunk people shouting in the corridor in the middle of the night, people playing loud music by the pool as if no one else is around, families treating public areas as if they were the neighborhood garbage dump....the list goes on and on
 THE HOTEL/HOSTEL SIDE
Third party review sites such as Tripadvisor, Expedia, Zomato, Hostelworld  and Yelp and many others, encourage potential guests to read about and rely on previous guests  experiences before making their decision.  What about the hotels? Why can they not rely on other hotels experience before making their decisions to accept guests or not and under which conditions? 
Problematic guests face absolutely no consequences for their actions. They can vandalize, steal,  be disrespectful to either staff or other guests, check out without paying and then cross the street to another hotel.  No one will ever find out about their past "history." 
Reviews and criticism are the best ways to let hotels know what things they are doing well and what things they need to improve. However, some guests misuse the power of a review as a way to “blackmail” a hotel, shamelessly asking for upgrades or discounts in exchange for not posting a negative review. 
With WhosYourGuest.com registered Hotels and other players in the Hospitality business have the ability to do the following:

 Search 
Search on a guests history before accepting their reservation


Report problematic guests:
After filling guests details, hotels and lodging facilities will be able to report the circumstances of a case. Each report is reviewed by  Whos Your Guest to make sure it complies with our reporting guidelines and receives a qualification score from 1, (minor things like “no shows”), to 5, (serious things like theft or leaving without paying).

 Hotels who receive reservations from reported guests will have the option to accept the reservation, accept with security measures like advance payment, charge more for the room because of the risk factor or decline the reservation.For severe cases in their area Hotels also receive an alert by Email.Whos your guest is already changing the conversation, relations and the way accommodation providers are communicating  with their guests.                       Imagine a world where people care for each other, respect local cultures and their people, and treat those around them with equality, consideration, and kindness.  .....wow, we want to live in such a world.By helping us to ensure that the only people who pay the consequences for the actions of inconsideration are the problematic guests themselves, we will be "eliminating" or reducing the negative in the tourism industry and the rest of us will be able to enjoy more our travels. This will be our little step toward living in a better world.  As a platform WYG has no legal liability for information published by its users.  Hotels and Hostels are responsible in obtaining the information from the guest in a legal way. (signed authorization)WYG is  responsible for the storing and the use of this information between its members.  WYG provides members with complete information and legal support about the requirements of the law in order to report problematic guestsAs much as possible....:-) This is how Whos Your Guest? will use the funds; according to priority:
A professional website that has the capability to allow members to search reported guests database and to send automatic alerts in case of new reports. The main emphasis will be on data protection technologies and a user-friendly interface - $20,000 
Legal assistance, verifying laws of different countries, writing user contracts etc. - $12,000

Orientation campaign for participating hotels and establishments regarding the legal obligations related to the collection and handling of personal information providing the required legal instruments needed to fulfill all obligations - $10,000

Expanding services to additional countries, searchers, data base builders, client service, graphic designers etc. -  from $15,000

Internet advertising (Facebook, Google etc.) - $15,000

Office space, salaries, overhead, etc. are all covered for the near future
All funds collected will be distributed according to the specifications illustrated above. The more funds we are able to procure, the more we can grow the business model, expand to other countries, and improve the level of services we offer. Any funds received above the above-stated amounts will be used toward the creation of a social network for hotels and hostels which is part of the bigger vision we have but it's still not the time to reveal it all...:-)When donating, if possible, please use the credit card option instead of the paypal, as with paypal there is an extra charge for us to receive your donationIf you are a big time investor, or know one, and realize the potential of this project, please drop us a line so we can chat further Since we are an internet platform we don't have any physical products to sell or give as perks at a discounted price. However, we know that bakers looove perks so we turned to the Hotels and hostels members of our network and they were more than happy to help. Most perks you will find following were donated by one of our members as a sign of their satisfaction and appreciation for the noble idea behind WYG. This also explains why most are available in Ecuador, Panama or Colombia......:-)             The dream teamCEO and founder - Inbal Tubi:   My name is Inbal, only 48 years, married + 2. Now I’m supposed to say my profession and nationality. I have a problem defining both.Let’s start with the profession. If it is defined but what you studied than since I’m a graduate of Ben-Gurion University in Israel with a degree in Economics and Business Management I guess I’m an economist. If it is defined by what you make you’re living from than since I have been owning hostels for the last 15 years I guess this makes me and independent business men. If it is defined by what you did most of your life, what you love and passionate about than since I have been traveling for the past 20 years, been to 83 countries, 6 continents and speak 5 languages I guess this makes me a traveler and globetrotter. If I have to choose between the three, that last one wins by far.Now for the Nationality. If it is defined by where you were born than, I’m Israeli. If it’s defined by your passports, than I’m also Brazilian. If it’s defined by where your heart belongs, than I’m African, if i t's defined by where you live now than I'm Colombian and if it’s defined by where you feel at home than I belong everywhere. Personally, I don’t like definitions because they are limiting, so I like to think of myself as from everywhere and nowhere.I have worked in almost all possible jobs there are. From frying French fries in NY, a fabric warehoused and a human dishwasher in Australia, selling jewelry on the streets of Japan, marketing manager for the wealthiest company in Israel with frequent travels abroad to owning and running a hostel in Brazil and just sold another one I had in Bogota, Colombia where I live today, to finance Whos Your Guest.  Unfortunately my dad could not give me a "small loan" of one million dollars  like Trumps dad did and funds are running out so I am depending on your generosity to help me continue with this very important project. In my spare time, I dream and plan my next travel. Final goal in life if to color every country on the world map tattooed on my back  CMO - Yahav Cohen            My name is Yahav, 33. playing on the internet and trading fields for over 10 years. but my big passion is to own and work on my own Permaculture farm.Meanwhile, my wife and I raise two kids a Doberman 3 chickens and two ducks in our urban garden.Build and launched an e-commerce art related website, taking part in a restaurant service startup.love to travel, snowboarding, camping and relax in my hammock after a long week.  COO - Motti Mor    My Name is Motti Mor. I am a 37 year old dreamer and website designer. I have been wondering in the internet realm since the beginning of the internet era and started designing websites some 15 years ago.My dream was always to work while I travel and I've followed it for many years and visited many parts of our exciting and beautiful planet.Nowadays, I've decided to stay in one place for a while. I am raising my two beautiful sons and hold an MBA degree focused on Web Marketing.I have met Inbal in NY about 20 years ago and ever since we have been walking side by side. I've joined  the " Whos Your Guest" project to try and make this world a just and better place.                 and the list can go on and on and on..............  Interesting statistics and reads:The most common offenses reported on our database:Booking sites problematic guests use:The top 10 Countries With Notoriously Bad TouristsTheft of hotel items: 4.5 million Germans do it / 1.3 million stolen towels​There are many ways you can help us to reach our goal and make your next vacation more pleasant (and hopefully cheaper too!)Here are three of them:
Contribute. Whether it is a $1 or a $1000 contribution, each one has an impact and gets us closer to our goal. 
Spread the word to everybody you know.  Ask your friends to share our campaign on their social media (e.g. Twitter, Facebook, Google+). Please use this direct link to our campaignhttps://igg.me/at/whosyourguest/13920702

          When you travel and see someone behaving badly dont just ignore it. Let the hotel managment know about Whos Your Guest and the actions they can take.Thank you so much for your help and support!       El objetivo final de Whos Your Guest es eliminar la necesidad de Whos Your Guest. Sí, lo leíste correctamente, queremos sacarnos a nosotros mismos del negocio ….:-) Pero, antes de poner tu mano de vuelta en tu bolsillo, espera un segundo. No va a suceder tan rápido.El filósofo chino Lao Tzu dijo: "Un viaje de mil millas comienza con un paso" y humildemente queremos añadir que es probablemente el primer paso el que es más difícil. Ya hemos dado ese primer paso y ahora queremos que nos acompañes en dar los próximosEL LADO DEL HUÉSPED

Usted es tratado de acuerdo a experiencias anteriores que el proveedor de alojamiento tenía con sus compatriotas. Cuando viajamos, no se refieren a nosotros por nuestro nombre sino por nuestra nacionalidad. Cuando un Britt deja una mala impresión, el próximo Britt será tratado en consecuencia a ésta y aunque estos turistas/viajeros problemáticos son la minoría, el impacto que dejan es mucho más grande que la proporción de su tamaño. Con sus malas acciones nos manchan a todos.

Pagas más por el comportamiento de otros.​Cuando el huésped de "pesadilla" destruye una habitación de hotel, roba batas de baño, se va sin pagar, etc. aumentan los costos de los hoteles. (Una encuesta reciente estimó que los viajeros alemanes por sí solos robaron mercancías por un valor de 37 millones de euros en el 2013. Tabla a continuación). Estos costos se pasan a usted, el huésped respetuoso de la ley, al aumentar las tarifas de habitación y eso no es justo

Arruinar sus vacaciones¿Quién entre nosotros no ha encontrado al huésped desagradable en una de nuestras vacaciones? Los huéspedes con malos comportamientos pueden arruinar nuestras tan duramente trabajadas y anheladas vacaciones. Personas ebrias gritando en el pasillo en medio de la noche, gente escuchando música a alto volumen en la piscina como si no hubiera nadie más, familias tratando las zonas públicas como si fueran el basurero del barrio ... la lista sigue y sigue

 EL LADO DEL HOTEL/HOSTEL
Terceros sitios de crítica/revisión como TripAdvisor, Expedia, Zomato, Hostelworld, Yelp y muchos otros, alientan a posibles clientes a leer y confiar en las experiencias de huéspedes anteriores antes de tomar su decisión. ¿Qué pasa con los hoteles? ¿Por qué ellos no pueden confiar en las experiencias previas de otros hoteles antes de tomar sus decisiones para aceptar huéspedes o no y bajo qué condiciones?
Huéspedes problemáticos no enfrentan absolutamente ninguna consecuencia por sus acciones. Pueden hacer actos de vandalismo, robar, ser irrespetuoso con el personal u otros huéspedes, salir sin pagar y luego cruzar la calle a otro hotel. Nadie sabrá jamás sobre su "historia" pasada. 
Comentarios y críticas son las mejores maneras de hacer saber a los hoteles qué cosas están haciendo bien y qué cosas necesitan mejorar. Sin embargo, algunos huéspedes usan mal el poder de una crítica como una forma de "chantaje" un hotel, descaradamente pidiendo mejoras o descuentos a cambio de no publicar una crítica negativa.
Con WhosYourGuest.com  los hoteles registrados y otros jugadores en el negocio de la hospitalidad tienen la capacidad de hacer lo siguiente:

 Buscar 
Buscar en la historia de huéspedes antes de aceptar su reserva


Reportar huéspedes problemáticos:
Después de diligenciar los detalles de los huéspedes, los hoteles y establecimientos de alojamiento serán capaces de reportar las circunstancias de un caso. Cada reporte es revisado por Whos Your Guest para asegurarse de que cumple con nuestras directrices de reporte y recibe una calificación de 1, (cosas menores como "no shows"), a 5 (cosas serias como robo o salir sin pagar).

 Los hoteles que reciben reservas de los huéspedes reportados tendrán la opción de aceptar la reserva, aceptar con medidas de seguridad como pago por adelantado, cobrar más por la habitación debido al riesgo o rechazar la reserva.Para casos severos en su área, los  hoteles también reciben una alerta por correo electrónico.Whos Your Guest ya está cambiando las conversaciones, las relaciones y la forma en que los proveedores de alojamiento están comunicándose con sus huéspedes.                      Imagine un mundo donde la gente se cuide el uno al otro, respete las culturas locales y su gente, y trate a los que les rodean con igualdad, consideración y bondad…. wow, queremos vivir en un mundo así.Al ayudarnos a asegurar que las únicas personas que paguen las consecuencias por los actos de desconsideración sean los huéspedes problemáticos por sí mismos, estaremos "eliminando" o reduciendo lo negativo en la industria del turismo y el resto de nosotros podremos disfrutar más nuestros viajes. Este será nuestro pequeño paso hacia la vida en un mundo mejor.  Como plataforma WYG no tiene ninguna responsabilidad legal por la información publicada por sus usuarios.Los hoteles y hostales son responsables de obtener la información del huésped de manera legal. (Autorización firmada)WYG es responsable del almacenamiento y el uso de esta información entre sus miembros.WYG proporciona a los miembros información completa y apoyo legal sobre los requisitos de la ley para informar a los huéspedes problemáticosTanto como sea posible .... :-) Así es como Whos Your Guest? Utilizará los fondos; por orden de prioridad:
Un sitio web profesional que tiene la capacidad de permitir a los miembros buscar huéspedes reportados en la base de datos y enviar alertas automáticas cuando hay nuevos reportes. El énfasis principal estará en las tecnologías de protección de datos y una interfaz fácil de usar - $ 20,000 
Asistencia legal, verificación de leyes de los diferentes países, redacción de contratos de usuarios, etc. - $ 12,000

Campaña de orientación para los hoteles y establecimientos participantes con respecto a las obligaciones legales relacionadas con la recolección y manejo de información personal proporcionando los instrumentos legales necesarios para cumplir con todas las obligaciones - $ 10,000

Ampliación de servicios a otros países, buscadores, constructores de bases de datos, servicio al cliente, diseñadores gráficos, etc. - desde $ 15,000

Publicidad en Internet (Facebook, Google, etc.) - $ 15.000

Espacio de oficina, sueldos, gastos generales, etc están cubiertos para el futuro cercano
Todos los fondos recaudados serán distribuidos de acuerdo con las especificaciones mencionadas anteriormente. Cuantos más fondos obtengamos, más podemos hacer crecer el modelo de negocio, expandirnos a otros países y mejorar el nivel de servicios que ofrecemos. Cualquier financiamiento recibido por encima de los montos arriba indicados se utilizará para la creación de una red social para hoteles y hostales que es parte de la visión más grande que tenemos, pero todavía no es el momento de revelar todo ... :-)Al donar, si es posible, utilice la opción de tarjeta de crédito en lugar del paypal, ya que con paypal hay un cargo adicional por recibir su donaciónSi usted es un gran inversor, o conoce uno, y se da cuenta del potencial de este proyecto, por favor, escríbanos para que podamos hablar más​ Puesto que somos una plataforma de Internet, no tenemos productos físicos que vender o dar como beneficios con un precio de descuento. Sin embargo, sabemos que los contribuyentes aaaaaman los beneficios, así que nos dirigimos a los hoteles y hostales miembros de nuestra red y estuvieron más que dispuestos a ayudar. La mayoría de los beneficios que encontrará a continuación fueron donados por uno de nuestros miembros como un muestra de su satisfacción y aprecio por la noble idea detrás de WYG. Esto también explica por qué la mayoría están disponibles en Ecuador, Panamá o Colombia ...... :-)The dream teamCEO y Fundador  - Inbal Tubi:​   Mi nombre es Inbal, sólo 48 años, casado + 2. Ahora se supone que tengo que decir mi profesión y nacionalidad. Tengo problemas para definir ambos.Empecemos con la profesión. Si es definido por lo que estudié, entonces desde que soy graduado de la Universidad de Ben-Gurion en Israel con un título en Economía y Administración de Empresas supongo que soy un economista. Si se define por lo que hago para vivir, desde que he sido dueño de hostales durante los últimos 15 años, supongo que esto me hace un hombre de negocios independiente. Si se define por lo que hice la mayor parte de mi vida, por lo que amo  y me apasiona, desde que he viajado por los últimos 20 años, he estado en 83 países, 6 continentes y hablo 5 idiomas, supongo que esto me hace un viajero y trotamundos. Si tengo que elegir entre los tres, éste último gana por mucho.Ahora por la nacionalidad. Si se define por donde nací, entonces soy Israelí. Si está definido por sus pasaportes, entonces también soy Brasileño. Si se define por dónde pertenece tu corazón, entonces soy Africano, si es definido por donde vives ahora  entonces soy Colombiano y si se define por donde te sientes como en casa entonces yo pertenezco a todas partes. Personalmente, no me gustan las definiciones porque son limitantes, así que me gusta pensar en mí como de todas partes y de ninguna parte.He trabajado en casi todos los trabajos posibles que hay. Desde la fritura de papas fritas en Nueva York, un almacén de telas y un lavavajillas humano en Australia, la venta de joyas en las calles de Japón, gerente de marketing para la empresa más rica en Israel con viajes frecuentes al extranjero, a ser propietario y dirigir un hostal Brasil y acabo de vender otro que tuve en Bogotá, Colombia donde vivo hoy, para financiar a Whos Your Guest. Desafortunadamente mi papá no podía darme un "pequeño préstamo" de un millón de dólares como el de papá de Trump hizo y los fondos se están acabando así que estoy dependiendo de su generosidad para ayudarme a continuar con este proyecto tan importante.En mi tiempo libre, sueño y planeo mi próximo viaje. Mi objetivo final en la vida es colorear cada país en el mapa del mundo tatuado en mi espalda CMO - Yahav Cohen            Mi nombre es Yahav, 33. Me he desempeñado en el Internet y los campos comerciales por más de 10 años. Pero mi gran pasión es poseer y trabajar en mi propia granja de Permacultura.Mientras tanto, mi esposa y yo criamos a dos niños, un Doberman, 3 pollos y dos patos en nuestro jardín urbano.Construí y lancé un sitio web de comercio electrónico relacionado con arte, y participando en un startup  de servicio de restaurante.Me encanta viajar, hacer snowboard, acampar y relajarme en mi hamaca después de una larga semana.  COO - Motti Mor    Mi nombre es Motti Mor. Soy un soñador de 37 años y diseñador de sitios web. He estado paseándome en el reino de Internet desde el principio de la era de Internet y comencé a diseñar sitios web hace unos 15 años.Mi sueño siempre fue trabajar mientras viajo y lo he seguido durante muchos años. He visitado muchas partes de nuestro emocionante y hermoso planeta.Hoy en día, he decidido quedarme en un lugar por un tiempo. Estoy criando a mis dos hermosos hijos y mantengo un MBA enfocado a  Web Marketing.Conocí a Inbal en Nueva York hace unos 20 años y desde entonces hemos estado caminando lado a lado. Me he unido al proyecto "Whos Your Guest" para tratar de hacer de este mundo un lugar mejor y más justo.                 and the list can go on and on and on..............  Interesting statistics and reads:The most common offenses reported on our database:Booking sites problematic guests use:The top 10 Countries With Notoriously Bad TouristsTheft of hotel items: 4.5 million Germans do it / 1.3 million stolen towels​Hay muchas maneras en las que puede ayudarnos a alcanzar nuestro objetivo y hacer que sus próximas vacaciones sean más agradables (y esperemos que sean más baratas!).Aquí están tres de ellos:
Contribuir. Ya se trate de una contribución de $1 o $1000, cada una tiene un impacto y nos acerca a nuestra meta. 
Corre la voz a todo el mundo que conoces. Pide a tus amigos que compartan nuestra campaña en sus redes sociales (por ejemplo, Twitter, Facebook, Google+). Por favor utilice este enlace directo a nuestra campaña https://igg.me/at/whosyourguest/13920702​ 
          Cuando viaje y vea a alguien comportándose mal, no lo ignore. Haga saber a la gerencia del hotel acerca de  Whos Your Guest y las acciones que pueden tomar.¡Muchas gracias por su ayuda y apoyo!

story:
What SyncGram is All About

“I never use calendars, checklists, or to-do lists.”“I take life as it comes.”

You may say these things, but wait just a moment. Think about your health. Don’t you at least care about your health? Haven’t you adopted some routines for your health and hygiene? Maybe you schedule your eating, exercise, or other practices. If you are like many people, you probably have.

But are you sure you are doing everything you need to for good health? You need a hygiene checklist. We have something perfect for you here - Hygiene Calendars.  Calendars are better than lists; they show the “what”like lists do, but additionally, our calendars show you “when”.  It is the “when”that makes acting more imperative.

That’s one reason to use SyncGram. SyncGram will contain approximately 200 calendars about basic things, like weather, hygiene, diet, education, beauty, etc. 

In calendars we make notes about events we want to remember. Readymade calendars have some events already noted. SyncGram will show many calendars together in an irresistible way. This overlapping calendar feature enables you to sync events so you can sync your life. SyncGram is not just about calendars, it’s about Sync.

SyncGram is made up of a platform and its applications. You will be able to find it at the SyncGram website and download the apps from Google Play Store and iTunes. The main goal of SyncGram is to provide you with several calendars and a set of unique management tools.

One of our goals is to concentrate all of the “when”data together and have it organized in sets. Every set will be contained in a main calendar. An example calendar is that of the weather. By combining all the “when”data such as temperature and rainfall you can see on one calendar the overlapping data of time, temperature, and rainfall amounts. If you combine this with the “when”data from your child’s soccer practice schedule you can learn even more. For example, you can see that it will be warm and dry at 4 pm during practice, but around 7 pm it will be cooler and rainy when you are back at home.

We will have a marketplace for publishers that want to upload custom calendars that would be available to users either for free, or at a cost. For example, television networks may upload free show schedule calendars for their viewers to use. Others, like dieticians will have the ability to upload calendars that would be for sale to anyone interested in a diet tracking calendar.  Consider some calendars that can be shared or published: 

  • A public calendar - one that a user wants to share with friends, family, or co-workers. 
  • Television, movies, and any other kind of scheduled show times.
  • Family activities such as sports games, piano lessons, or planned weekend activities.
  • Appointment or reservation books. We will give you a full reservation system and a marketplace dedicated to them. 
  • Natural processes of any kind, for example, the phases of plant development, cycles of an illness, etc.
  • To-do lists and checklists.

Anything that exists and can be imagined as a series of events can be entered into a calendar. 


The Magnitude of What Contributors Will Help us Achieve

Our contributors will help individuals that use the app save large amounts of time by easily knowing what to do and when. Because you can find many calendars on the same site and by combining them easily the user can very quickly make better decisions. This will make people’s lives more organized and productive.

On a social level, the benefits for business are even greater. Anyone that uses SyncGram as a reservation system will save a significant amount of money compared to corresponding systems that cost much more. SyncGram will make it very inexpensive to manage reservations - just $1 for 1000 reservations. For anything someone wants to rent you can create a reservation calendar and all these calendars will be together in one marketplace. This will help the “share economy”model and we will have far more effective and efficient use of resources. 


Who Will Produce, Operate and Host Syncgram?

My name is Dimitris Zisimopoulos. I am 51 years old. I am the managing director of Crystal Cut s.a. (www.crystal-cut.com). Crystal Cut is an IT service provider specializing in marketing and big customer data. Crystal Cut was established in 2000 in Greece. We have worked for many multinational companies including IBM, Microsoft, Barclaycard, Ford, Volvo, Mars, and others. Crystal Cut has 30 people on staff. Ten of them are IT engineers. Most of our employees have at least a University diploma.

I have a Bachelor’s degree in Management and an MBA from Athens University of Economics and Business. I have worked as a software programmer, analyst, and marketer.

We will host SyncGram in Rackspace. 


Main Components and Features

Web app, Android, IOS.
Reservation Marketplace
Calendar Publishers Marketplace
Calendar Module

  • Compact view
  • Layers, calendar merge
  • Reminders
  • Task repeats
  • Agenda, three days, weekly, monthly, yearly format
  • Import, export, share
  • Sync with Google Calendar, Outlook and Ical 
Contacts
To do
Appointment Scheduling Module
- Built in PayPal payment system
Weather module
  • Weather for almost any location on earth, 14 days forecast per three hours per day
Languages of version 1.0: English, Greek 


What We Need

We need $300,000. This amount will finance the cost of labor for a team of 15 people for 6 months ($50,000 per month). 

The team will consist of:

  • 1 analyst - project manager
  • 1 analyst - assistant project manager 
  • 2 engineers - database layer
  • 2 engineers - transaction layer
  • 2 engineers - web UI layer
  • 2 engineers - android apps development
  • 2 engineers - IOS apps development
  • 2 designers
  • 1 marketing manager


    • What You Get

    In order to create an unlimited number of calendars you must have a license. It will cost $8,80 for life (all upgrades are free).

    By helping us with financing now you will get:


    Where the Funds Go if We Don't Reach Our Entire Goal

    We must deliver what we describe here in the time we claim. If we do not reach our entire goal and cannot find funds elsewhere, we will give you back the amount of money that will have entered our account. In other words, you get the license to use a ready app or the money we received from you i.e. your contribution amount minus the transaction costs. Transaction costs are 12% - 14%. This is money we will have never taken.


    Risks & Challenges

    We are not a start up. Our ability to manage large projects successfully has been proven. The risk of SyncGram’s success lies in the marketing and communication skills which directly affects to the ability to raise the necessary funds. The success of a product is not always a matter of quality and its ability to satisfy consumers - the way it is promoted is also very critical.

    The different elements of SyncGram can be found dispersed in various applications and locations such as Google calendar, appointment scheduling platforms, weather apps, checklists sites, in books, in the description of processes and so on. SyncGram is a trial to integrate all of these together in one place and to standardize the way an overlapping series of time can be shown and handled. It is somewhat difficult to express this idea in simple terms. We hope to meet people with open eyes and ears. In the end this is an enterprise, not a certainty.

    Every Dollar Counts

    Help us to make our vision a reality. You may or may not be able to afford to contribute money right now, but your time is very critical too. Please give some of it to help spread the word about SyncGram! You can do it right now through Indiegogo’s share tools!
story_txt:
What SyncGram is All About
“I never use calendars, checklists, or to-do lists.”“I take life as it comes.”
You may say these things, but wait just a moment. Think about your health. Don’t you at least care about your health? Haven’t you adopted some routines for your health and hygiene? Maybe you schedule your eating, exercise, or other practices. If you are like many people, you probably have.
But are you sure you are doing everything you need to for good health? You need a hygiene checklist. We have something perfect for you here - Hygiene Calendars.  Calendars are better than lists; they show the “what”like lists do, but additionally, our calendars show you “when”.  It is the “when”that makes acting more imperative.
That’s one reason to use SyncGram. SyncGram will contain approximately 200 calendars about basic things, like weather, hygiene, diet, education, beauty, etc. 
In calendars we make notes about events we want to remember. Readymade calendars have some events already noted. SyncGram will show many calendars together in an irresistible way. This overlapping calendar feature enables you to sync events so you can sync your life. SyncGram is not just about calendars, it’s about Sync.
SyncGram is made up of a platform and its applications. You will be able to find it at the SyncGram website and download the apps from Google Play Store and iTunes. The main goal of SyncGram is to provide you with several calendars and a set of unique management tools.One of our goals is to concentrate all of the “when”data together and have it organized in sets. Every set will be contained in a main calendar. An example calendar is that of the weather. By combining all the “when”data such as temperature and rainfall you can see on one calendar the overlapping data of time, temperature, and rainfall amounts. If you combine this with the “when”data from your child’s soccer practice schedule you can learn even more. For example, you can see that it will be warm and dry at 4 pm during practice, but around 7 pm it will be cooler and rainy when you are back at home.
We will have a marketplace for publishers that want to upload custom calendars that would be available to users either for free, or at a cost. For example, television networks may upload free show schedule calendars for their viewers to use. Others, like dieticians will have the ability to upload calendars that would be for sale to anyone interested in a diet tracking calendar.  Consider some calendars that can be shared or published: 

A public calendar - one that a user wants to share with friends, family, or co-workers. 
Television, movies, and any other kind of scheduled show times.
Family activities such as sports games, piano lessons, or planned weekend activities.
Appointment or reservation books. We will give you a full reservation system and a marketplace dedicated to them. 
Natural processes of any kind, for example, the phases of plant development, cycles of an illness, etc.
To-do lists and checklists.

Anything that exists and can be imagined as a series of events can be entered into a calendar. 
The Magnitude of What Contributors Will Help us Achieve
Our contributors will help individuals that use the app save large amounts of time by easily knowing what to do and when. Because you can find many calendars on the same site and by combining them easily the user can very quickly make better decisions. This will make people’s lives more organized and productive.
On a social level, the benefits for business are even greater. Anyone that uses SyncGram as a reservation system will save a significant amount of money compared to corresponding systems that cost much more. SyncGram will make it very inexpensive to manage reservations - just $1 for 1000 reservations. For anything someone wants to rent you can create a reservation calendar and all these calendars will be together in one marketplace. This will help the “share economy”model and we will have far more effective and efficient use of resources. 
Who Will Produce, Operate and Host Syncgram?

My name is Dimitris Zisimopoulos. I am 51 years old. I am the managing director of Crystal Cut s.a. (www.crystal-cut.com). Crystal Cut is an IT service provider specializing in marketing and big customer data. Crystal Cut was established in 2000 in Greece. We have worked for many multinational companies including IBM, Microsoft, Barclaycard, Ford, Volvo, Mars, and others. Crystal Cut has 30 people on staff. Ten of them are IT engineers. Most of our employees have at least a University diploma.
I have a Bachelor’s degree in Management and an MBA from Athens University of Economics and Business. I have worked as a software programmer, analyst, and marketer.
We will host SyncGram in Rackspace. 
Main Components and Features
Web app, Android, IOS.
Reservation Marketplace
Calendar Publishers Marketplace
Calendar Module

Compact view
Layers, calendar merge
Reminders
Task repeats
Agenda, three days, weekly, monthly, yearly format
Import, export, share
Sync with Google Calendar, Outlook and Ical 

Contacts
To do
Appointment Scheduling Module
- Built in PayPal payment system
Weather module

Weather for almost any location on earth, 14 days forecast per three hours per day


Languages of version 1.0: English, Greek 
What We Need
We need $300,000. This amount will finance the cost of labor for a team of 15 people for 6 months ($50,000 per month). 
The team will consist of:
1 analyst - project manager
1 analyst - assistant project manager 
2 engineers - database layer
2 engineers - transaction layer
2 engineers - web UI layer
2 engineers - android apps development
2 engineers - IOS apps development
2 designers
1 marketing manager
What You Get
In order to create an unlimited number of calendars you must have a license. It will cost $8,80 for life (all upgrades are free).
By helping us with financing now you will get:Where the Funds Go if We Don't Reach Our Entire Goal
We must deliver what we describe here in the time we claim. If we do not reach our entire goal and cannot find funds elsewhere, we will give you back the amount of money that will have entered our account. In other words, you get the license to use a ready app or the money we received from you i.e. your contribution amount minus the transaction costs. Transaction costs are 12% - 14%. This is money we will have never taken.
Risks & Challenges
We are not a start up. Our ability to manage large projects successfully has been proven. The risk of SyncGram’s success lies in the marketing and communication skills which directly affects to the ability to raise the necessary funds. The success of a product is not always a matter of quality and its ability to satisfy consumers - the way it is promoted is also very critical.
The different elements of SyncGram can be found dispersed in various applications and locations such as Google calendar, appointment scheduling platforms, weather apps, checklists sites, in books, in the description of processes and so on. SyncGram is a trial to integrate all of these together in one place and to standardize the way an overlapping series of time can be shown and handled. It is somewhat difficult to express this idea in simple terms. We hope to meet people with open eyes and ears. In the end this is an enterprise, not a certainty.
Every Dollar Counts
Help us to make our vision a reality. You may or may not be able to afford to contribute money right now, but your time is very critical too. Please give some of it to help spread the word about SyncGram! You can do it right now through Indiegogo’s share tools!

story:
CAROMELL – a floating platform for alternative living

CAROMELL - ein Hausfloß für alternatives Leben


Who are we?

We are CARO and MELLI, two students of architecture from Berlin, Germany but more importantly, close friends. As a conclusion of our master's program we want to relive all building phases: from conceptual design to realization - with minimal budget!

We want to design according to the design-build concept and cooperate with many project partners to design, plan and build. Like that we built a school in Cameroon in 2013-15. We consider it as important to present less glossy concepts, but rather to transmit a sense of awareness: how one wants to live and how one collects own experiences to understand the world individually.

Wer sind wir?

Wir sind CARO und MELLI, zwei Architekturstudentinnen aus Berlin, Deutschland,  aber viel wichtiger, enge Freunde. Als Abschluss unseres Masterstudiums wollen wir vom konzeptionellen Entwurf bis hin zur Realisierung noch einmal alle Bauphasen durchleben - mit minimalem Budget! Wir möchten nach dem Design-Build-Konzept gemeinsam mit möglichst vielen Projektpartnern entwerfen, planen und bauen. Damit haben wir Erfahrung, denn 2013-15 bauten wir so in Kamerun eine Schule.

Wir erachten es als wichtig, weniger fertige Hochglanzkonzepte zu präsentieren, sondern vielmehr ein Gefühl zu vermitteln, sich dessen bewusst zu werden, wie man leben möchte und somit dem Betrachter die Chance ermöglichen, selbst Experte zu werden, eigene Erfahrungen zu sammeln und die Welt auf individuelle Weise zu verstehen und zu gestalten.


What is CAROMELL?

The CAROMELL is a mobile, floating platform that enables innovative, temporary living. We want to reinterpret the classic houseboat typology. How can we build without property? We want to conquer the space on the water. This platform also incorporate the changes in society to flexible and mobile activities. We understand wanderlust as a expression of a lifestyle. 

The following picture, shows a collage of our Caromell draft.

Was ist CAROMELL?

Die CAROMELL ist einen mobiler, schwimmender Körper, der innovativ vorübergehendes Bewohnen ermöglicht. Dabei möchten wir den klassischen Hausboottypus neu interpretieren und kleiner realisieren.
Wie kann man heute in Berlin ohne Baugrundstück bauen? (T)Raum auf dem Wasser ist die Lösung.

Das Hausfloß greift das Bedürfnis der modernen Gesellschaft nach Mobilität auf, soziale Aktivitäten sind oft räumlich voneinander getrennt. Wir verbinden diese und gehen zusätzlich auf das innerliche Begehren nach Ortsunabhängigkeit ein. Das Unterwegssein ist Ausdruck eines Lebensstils.

Das folgende Bild zeigt ein Collage unseres Caromell - Entwurfes.


Building

We want to build: to shape our environment, to give a new life to 'old' material, not to plan exclusively in front of a screen, to balance out exuberant consume and basic needs. Everybody who wants to build something too, is warmly invited to help us at the plot in Gosen.

Bauen

Wir wollen bauen: um unsere Umwelt selbst einzurichten und vermeintlich unbrauchbar gewordene Materialien wieder aufbereiten und so neues Leben einhauchen, nicht nur am Computer planen und den Spielraum zwischen verschwenderischem Konsum und grundlegender Versorgung auszuloten. Jeder der mitbauen möchte, ist herzlich nach Gosen auf das Baugrundstück eingeladen, um zu helfen.

You can see, we already collected a lot of basic materials and already started to build.

Wie du siehst, haben wir bereits viele Materialien sammeln können und mit dem Bau bereits angefangen.


Back to nature!

With this project we confront free-time in nature with a daily-life living. The implementation of small holiday-houses on the water close to residential areas could be an answer to the complex needs of society. This could be the mock-up for a generation that wants to live everywhere for a time.

Zurück zur Natur!

Mit dem Projekt untersuchen wir die Balance zwischen Freizeit in der Natur und einer alltäglichen Wohnsituation. Die Eingliederung der Datsche auf dem Wasser in das Wohngebiet kann eine Antwort auf die differenzierten Bedürfnisse und auf die zunehmende Komplexität des gesellschaftlichen Lebens sein. Das Hausfloß kann ein Modell für eine Generation sein, die an jedem Ort der Welt für eine Zeit lang zu Hause sein kann und möchte.


Recreation

CAROMELL is a space to calm and relax with fresh air, a garden, a place of creativity, conviviality and for travel. If you board it you step into freedom, enjoyment and tranquillity - far away of working routine. It will be build in a way that the private core is protected, but the outer opens up generously to the surrounding.

Erholung

Die CAROMELL ist ein Ort der Ruhe, Erholung, des Ausspannens und Abreagierens, der frischen Luft, eines Gartens, von künstlerischer Kreativität, Geselligkeit, sowie des Urlaubs- und Reiseersatz. Die Ankunft auf dem Hausfloß erscheint als der ersehnte Eintritt in die Welt der Freiheit, des Genießerischem und der Gelassenheit, frei von den Einschränkungen der Alltagsroutine. Das Innere des Bungalows bleibt oft abgeschottet , das Äußere hingegen öffnet sich zur Außenwelt.


Future

The water of Berlin could become a niche for alternative culture and a space where all classes come together. There is enough space that could connect future low-budget-captains and foster the already existing strong scene.

Zukunft

Die Wasserwege in Berlin könnten eine stadtdurchziehende Nische für alternative Kultur und ein Ort, an dem alle Schichten zusammenfinden, werden. Platz genug wäre jedenfalls da und das ganz ohne (Bau)Grund, um uns „Low-Budget-Schiffer“ und die bereits existierende eng vernetzte Szene zu vereinen und zu stärken.


Why do we need your money?

For finishing the CAROMELL and passing the next summer with you on it, we need some construction parts that we can't built with recycled materials.

For example:

  • an engine
  •  constructional connecting elements like screws, bolts and brackets
  • varnishes and impregnations
  • a solar battery
  • an anchor

Wofür brauchen wir euer Geld?

Um das Floß wirklich fahrtüchtig machen zu können und um gemeinsam die zukünftigen Sommer mit euch darauf verbringen zu können, benötigt dieses eine gewisse Ausstattung, welche wir leider nicht aus recycelten Materialien aufbereiten können.

Dazu gehören unter anderem:

  • ein Motor
  • diverse Verbindungselemente wie Schrauben, Bolzen und Winkel
  • Bootslacke und Imprägnierungen
  • eine Solarbatterie
  • ein Anker


So help us, we are all in the same boat. You can see on our facebook-page, what we have done so far: https://www.facebook.com/caromellhaus

Also helft uns, wir sitzen schließlich alle in einem Boot.Was wir bisher geschafft haben erfahrt ihr auf unserer Facebookseite: https://www.facebook.com/caromellhaus


THANK YOU! Sharing is caring. One love.

Caro & Melli
